refnamediv.refpurpose: Gets the current configuration setting of magic quotes gpc

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: Returns the current configuration setting of magic_quotes_gpc (0 for off, 1 for on).

note.para: If the directive magic_quotes_sybase is ON it will completely override magic_quotes_gpc. So even when get_magic_quotes_gpc returns &true; neither double quotes, backslashes or NUL's will be escaped. Only single quotes will be escaped. In this case they'll look like: ''

refsect1.simpara: Keep in mind that the setting magic_quotes_gpc will not work at runtime.

example.title: get_magic_quotes_gpc example
example.programlisting:
<?php
echo get_magic_quotes_gpc();         // 1
echo $_POST['lastname'];             // O\'reilly
echo addslashes($_POST['lastname']); // O\\\'reilly

if (!get_magic_quotes_gpc()) {
    $lastname = addslashes($_POST['lastname']);
} else {
    $lastname = $_POST['lastname'];
}

echo $lastname; // O\'reilly
$sql = "INSERT INTO lastnames (lastname) VALUES ('$lastname')";
?>

refsect1.para: For more information about magic_quotes, see this security section.
refsect1.simpara: See also addslashes, stripslashes, get_magic_quotes_runtime, and ini_get.
